p: There are two requirements for a set of nodes to be called a community: a large enough proportion of nodes in the set must be connected to one another, and the set must be sparsely connected to external nodes [ 5]. Formally, a proposed split of nodes into communities is evaluated using a modularity score [ 3]. Different node partitions are proposed and scored, the objective being to identify the partition that maximizes this score: a higher maximum modularity implies a more apparent community structure.
